sn15.7:1.2: Then several mendicants went up to the Buddha … and asked him,
sn15.7:1.6: how many eons have passed, how many hundreds or thousands or hundreds of thousands of eons.”
sn15.7:2.1: “But sir, is it possible to give a simile?”
sn15.7:2.3: “Suppose there were four disciples with a lifespan of a hundred years.
sn15.7:2.4: And each day they would each recollect a hundred thousand eons.
sn15.7:2.5: Those four disciples would pass away after a hundred years and there would still be eons that they haven’t recollected.
sn15.7:2.6: That’s how many eons have passed.
sn15.7:2.8: how many eons have passed, how many hundreds or thousands or hundreds of thousands of eons.
sn15.7:2.10: This transmigration has no known beginning. …
sn15.7:2.11: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed regarding all conditions.”
